toc_entry.title: Going For Broke
toc_entry.description: In boom times, John Connally and Ben Barnes used their political magic to build a sprawling real estate empire. Now they’re in a desperate struggle to keep themselves afloat.

toc_entry.title: Where Nasa Went Wrong
toc_entry.description: The seeds of the Challenger disaster were sowed long ago, in the space agency’s conflict between its ideals and its politics.

toc_entry.title: After the Tears
toc_entry.description: Cambodian Lay Bun Sun escaped the terrors of the Khmer Rouge to film his dreams in Houston.

toc_entry.title: The Strange Case Of Mark White
toc_entry.description: The governor has a good record, good ideas, and good intentions. So why is he in danger of losing his job to a man he already beat once?.

toc_entry.title: The Texas Institute Of Letters
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: Belonging to this literary club is a lot like becoming a Texan; you can be a newcomer for only so long.

toc_entry.title: Beyond Halloween
toc_entry.description: On the Day of the Dead, Mexicans mock death with candy skulls and papier-mache coffins. But in the darkness of a graveside vigil, the mockery gives way to tears.

toc_entry.title: The Barbecue Brothers
toc_entry.description: The six Mikeska boys may share the same family name, but each has his own ideas about the nuances of Texas barbecue.

toc_entry.title: The Eye Of the Beholder
toc_entry.description: A museum in Texas is the last place Jacques-Louis David would expect to find his late masterpiece, but we’re glad it’s here.

toc_entry.title: Yodelady, Yodelady. . . Hoo
toc_entry.subtitle: Western Art
toc_entry.description: An interpretation of a classic genre.

toc_entry.title: Ballad Of the Plne Springs Cafe
toc_entry.subtitle: Back Roads
toc_entry.description: Over the years, this boot-scuffed cafe has been host to West Texas yarn spinners and front-porch gossips. Now the stories are told on borrowed time.

toc_entry.title: The Museum That Time Forgot
toc_entry.subtitle: Texana
toc_entry.description: It’s one of the best-kept secrets in the state. But what the Texas Memorial Museum needs is somebody’s attention.

toc_entry.title: Country Music’s Hermit Saint
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: Don Williams won’t do beer commercials, sign autographs, or sing in honky-tonks. If that means he isn’t a superstar, that’s fine with him.

toc_entry.title: Partners In Crime
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: David Lindsey stalks Houston cops, through the violence and around the blood, in search of another mystery novel.

toc_entry.title: For the Love Of Bach
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: The Dallas Bach Society combines crackerjack musicians, a well-trained choir, and top-ranked vocal soloists—the result is a baroque-music lover’s dream....

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: The Harris County Administration Building just isn’t big enough for both Jon Lindsay and Mike Driscoll; Ray Perryman, a reporter’s best friend; a lucky accident brought Ethiopians—and Ethiopian restaurants—to Dallas.

toc_entry.title: The Quidnunc
toc_entry.description: Governor White nods off; Watauga policeman on the wagon; debutante dos and don’ts.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: A price for peace on the Guadalupe River; favorites and long shots in the Texas racetrack derby; a key decision for Lloyd Bentsen.
